page.title: 13SANDWICK - FARMS
page.content: {Mr A. Macdonald}owns two farms. Between the farms there are two hundred and eighteen acres of ground. He uses thirty three acres for croping on a rotational basis and one hundred and eighty five for grazing. He has {beef suckler cows}and{black faced {sheep}which are crossed with{suffolk {rams}to produce fat lambs for {slaughter.}Some of his cattle are bred and some are bought. His crops are grown mainly for animal feed, whilst potatoes, cabbages, turnips and other vegtables are sold to supply shops in town. {Chemicals and organic methods}are both used on the farms. Both fencing and stone dyke walls are used.Whinne bushes are also grown along the boundaries to aford shelter for the stock.
